articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Senegalese President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Senegalese President
 Pyongyang, April 5 (KCNA) -- Talks between Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, and Abdoulaye Wade, president Senegal, were held at the Presidential Palace Sunday.
					 Abdoulaye Wade said that he was pleased with the successful erection of the "Monument to Revival of Africa" with the help of able technicians from the DPRK.
					
					 Each country has a sovereign right in choosing its line, he said, supporting the independent politics of the DPRK.
					
					 At the talks both sides exchanged views on the issue of consolidating the friendly ties with a good tradition between the two countries and boosting the bilateral relations and matters of mutual concern.
					
					 Present there were Kim Hyong Jun, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and Ri Kyong Son, DPRK ambassador to Senegal, and Diof, minister of State and concurrently minister of Foreign Affairs, Oumar D. Ba., diplomatic adviser to the president, and Papa Mohamed Camara, special adviser to the president.
					
					 The talks proceeded in a friendly atmosphere.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Awarded Highest Order of Senegal
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Awarded Highest Order of Senegal
 Pyongyang, April 5 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was awarded Grand National Cross, the highest order of Senegal, by Abdoulaye Wade, president of Senegal.
					 The Senegalese president on April 4 handed the order to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on an official goodwill visit to Senegal.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Attends Senegalese Independence Events
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Attends Senegalese Independence Events
 Pyongyang, April 5 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on an official goodwill visit to Senegal, participated in the events celebrating the golden jubilee of its independence on April 4.
					 A military parade of the Senegalese army and a demonstration of people took place in Dakar on Sunday to celebrate the significant day of independence. 
					
					 They were watched by Abdoulaye Wade, president of Senegal, personages of different circles, commanders of armed forces, tens of thousands of Dakar citizens, heads of state and government of African countries, high-level delegations, representatives of international and regional organizations and diplomatic envoys of various countries and representatives of international organizations in Senegal.

articles.title: KPA Holds US Side Responsible for Leaving Remains of GIs
articles.content:
KPA Holds US Side Responsible for Leaving Remains of GIs
 Pyongyang, April 5 (KCNA) -- The representative of the Panmunjom Mission of the Korean People's Army released following statement Monday as regards the fact that the U.S. side turned away from the good faith and efforts made by the DPRK side to take a prompt measure for a number of remains of the GIs randomly left, after being pushed aside by bulldozers and picked up by farming implements in different parts of the DPRK for such preposterous political reason as "six-party talks":
					 On 27th Jan. and on 26th Feb. Panmunjom Mission of the KPA informed the U.S. Department of Defense through a south Korea stationed-U.S. Army delegate of the detailed realities related to the Korean War U.S. remains in the DPRK, most of which were damaged and randomly left in the process of large-scale land realignment and farming preparations in over ten places including Kujang County, Unsan County and Jangjin area in the DPRK.
					
					 At the meeting, our side also handed over several photos taken of typical remains and dogtag bearing the name of Ackly Philip W. and service number 20139638 and then urged the U.S. DoD to take urgent steps.
					
					 However, U.S. DoD has sent no reply until now when scores of days have passed, merely saying: "Returning the remains of U.S. servicemen back home is an important policy of the U.S. government. But, because of the internal affairs, no determination has been made yet. So, please wait a bit."
					
					 Besides, the U.S. Department of State openly turned its face away from our humanitarian sincerity, asserting: "Any bilateral negotiation between the U.S. and North Korea would not be possible out of the context of the six-party talks. The same can be said of such humanitarian issue as the U.S. remains recovery. This is a viewpoint of the United States."
					
					 We are very surprised at the U.S. which is turning away from the fact that its servicemen's remains are being spoiled and scattered here and there in the DPRK due to the political reason, because the U.S. has so far justified itself, insisting that a humanitarian issue would never go together with politics.
					
					 As for the U.S. remains buried in the DPRK, they are the remains of the U.S. servicemen who had killed recklessly our people and committed hostile acts against our Republic.
					
					 Therefore, we have neither responsibility nor obligation to recover and transfer those remains, the mark of the towering grudge of our people.
					
					 However, taking into fullest account the humanitarian nature of U.S. remains recovery and the earnest requests of Korean War bereaved families and the former U.S. administration, and especially the fact that during his visit to Pyongyang former U.S. President Carter had personally asked the respected President Kim Il Sung to help over that issue and had this matter resolved, our side, even if the DPRK-U.S. hostile relations have continued, specially permitted the Joint Field Activities of the U.S. remains.
					
					 So far, our side recovered and transferred 229 sets of U.S. remains to the U.S. DoD by conducting 33 Joint Field Activities.
					
					 Not only the U.S. DoD officials concerned, the U.S. veteran organizations, and bereaved families but also even the then U.S. President Clinton repeatedly expressed thanks for our humanitarian sincerity and efforts.
					
					 But, as soon as it took office, the Bush administration labeled the DPRK as "axis of evil" and "outpost of tyranny" and committed inhuman acts of suspending the JFAs of U.S. remains unilaterally in violation of the agreement reached between the KPA and the U.S. DoD, though it has been conducted smoothly for ten years.
					
					 As for "personal safety assurance", which the U.S. regarded as a pretext for suspending the JFAs unilaterally, our side did its best to ensure the personal safety of the U.S. team members. 
					
					 That was why not a single abnormal case has occurred in ten years of the JFAs.
					
					 Rather, the Americans who took part in the JFAs of U.S. remains in the DPRK frankly said several times that they worked in much better conditions as compared with those in other countries.
					
					 In fact "the problem of ensuring personal safety" was no more than sheer sophism deliberately spread by the U.S. to cover up its sinister political purpose.
					
					 Our standpoint is clear.
					
					 If the U.S. turns away from our sincerity and efforts to take urgent steps concerning the U.S. remains now being damaged and randomly scattered by bulldozers and farming tools in various parts of our country for such a groundless political reason as "six-party talks", there will be no way for us, too.
					
					 The disposal of remains of the U.S. servicemen is up to the U.S. DoD, the party concerned.
					
					 Though lots of U.S. remains are being dug out and scattered here and there in our country, our side will no longer be concerned about it.
					
					 If thousands of U.S. remains buried in our country are washed off and lost due to the U.S. side's disregard, the U.S. side should be wholly responsible for the consequences as it has developed the humanitarian issue into a political problem.

articles.title: Swedish Red Cross Delegation Here
articles.content:
Swedish Red Cross Delegation Here
 Pyongyang, April 5 (KCNA) -- A Swedish Red Cross delegation led by Vice President Asa Molde arrived here Monday. 
					 It was greeted at the airport by an official concerned and the head of the delegation of the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies working in the DPRK.

articles.title: Heaven Day Ceremony of Chondoism Held
articles.content:
Heaven Day Ceremony of Chondoism Held
 Pyongyang, April 5 (KCNA) -- The Heaven Day Ceremony was held here on Monday to mark the 150th founding anniversary of Chondoism. 
					 Present there were Ryu Mi Yong, chairwoman of the Central Guidance Committee of the Chondoist Association of Korea, officials of the committee and Chondoists in Pyongyang.
					
					 The vice-chairperson of the committee made a report at the ceremony.
					
					 The reporter said that Chondoism was founded for the purposes of "rejecting the West and Japan," "promoting national interests and welfare of the people," "realizing Kwangje Changsaeng (deliverance of the people)" and "building an earthly paradise" reflecting the desires and requirements of the Korean people in their struggle against feudalism and aggression in the second half of the 19th century, adding that the patriotic struggle of the Chondoists is recorded in the shining history of the Korean nation.
					
					 The grand march for independent reunification which has made dynamic advance as desired and wished by all fellow countrymen is facing serious difficulties due to the vicious racket of the south Korean conservative ruling group for confrontation with the DPRK and its war moves, the reporter said, calling on all the Chondoists who truly love the country and are concerned about its destiny to achieve "unity in purpose" under the banner of "By our nation itself" and turn out as one in the actions for frustrating the evermore undisguised anti-reunification and confrontation moves of the conservative authorities of south Korea, improving the inter-Korean relations and promoting national reconciliation and cooperation.
					
					 The reporter appealed to all the Chondoists in the north and the south to work heart and soul for accomplishing the sacred cause of independent reunification by implementing the north-south joint declarations this significant year which marks the 10th anniversary of the publication of the historic June 15 joint declaration.
					
					 The attendants of the ceremony prayed for earlier national reunification so that the idea of Chondoism may come true.

articles.title: Food Festival to Be Held
articles.content:
Food Festival to Be Held
 Pyongyang, April 5 (KCNA) -- The 15th April Holiday Food Festival has been prepared in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					The organizing committee has already been formed and its general, judging and managing subcommittees are active for a successful festival.
					
					 Kang Ki Jong, vice-chairman of the Korean Association of Cooks told KCNA that food competitions and exhibitions and reception contests have been held by the General Bureau of Public Service, Kyonghung Guidance Bureau and other units as part of preparations for the festival and that provincial festivals have also finished.
					
					 Meanwhile, diplomas and medals for the festival have been instituted and the fully-furnished festival venue and lodging places are waiting for the participants.
					
					 The food festival will be held in the People's Palace of Culture in Pyongyang between April 6 and 8 to mark Day of the Sun, birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (April 15), amid great interest of public catering establishments and housewives throughout the country.

articles.title: Japan's Threat to Chongryon Termed Political Terror
articles.content:
Japan's Threat to Chongryon Termed Political Terror
 Pyongyang, April 5 (KCNA) -- Japanese right-wing gangsters sent an enveloped threatening letter containing the shears blade to Kobe Korean high school in Hyogo Prefecture recently. This was a product of the Japanese reactionaries' deliberate and premeditated criminal plot to stifle the DPRK and the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon). 
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday observes this in a signed commentary.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 It is the way of thinking of the Japanese reactionaries that only by intensifying the threat and suppression of the Korean schools and Koreans in Japan under Chongryon they can force them to retract their demand for the inclusion in the tuition-free program for senior high schools and achieve their criminal aim with ease.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries are resorting to desperate threat and blackmail even against the Korean schools after singling them out as targets of terrorism, not content with their frantic moves to crack down upon Chongryon, seized with the hostility towards the DPRK. 
					
					 This grave development goes to patently prove that the Japanese reactionaries are the villains and wicked national chauvinists who utterly disregard the elementary ethics and morality, international law and diplomatic practice.
					
					 The recent threat to the above-said schools was an undisguised politically motivated provocation perpetrated by the Japanese reactionaries against the DPRK and Chongryon in pursuance of Japan's hostile policy toward the DPRK.
					
					 It bitterly denounces the above-said threat made by right-wing gangsters of Japan as a reckless action of those mad with the hostile policy toward the DPRK and national chauvinism.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries are making desperate efforts to suffocate the DPRK and Chongryon but these will get them nowhere. 
					
					 With nothing can they destroy Chongryon, a dignified overseas citizens' organization of the DPRK, and the Korean schools in Japan.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries would be well advised to stop their anachronistic moves against the DPRK and those to suppress Chongryon. The Japanese authorities should ferret out those involved in the above-mentioned incident and severely punish the criminals.

articles.title: Japan's Discrimination against Korean Schools Assailed
articles.content:
Japan's Discrimination against Korean Schools Assailed
 Pyongyang, April 5 (KCNA) -- Japan is now becoming evermore undisguised in its moves to exclude only the Korean schools under the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) from the tuition-free program for senior high schools. It is a product of the national chauvinist policy peculiar to Japan and its very old  vicious hostile policy towards the DPRK as it is another base and premeditated action of the Japanese reactionaries to violate the democratic national rights of Chongryon and Koreans in Japan. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday observes this in a signed article.
					
					 It continues:
					
					 The above-said issue is not a simple financial matter as to whether the Japanese authorities provide a petty amount of money to the Korean schools or not.
					
					 The Korean students in Japan are the descendants of those Koreans who were forcibly taken to Japan by the Japanese imperialists in the past and their schools are the legitimate institutions for national education operated by Chongryon with the permission of the Japanese government. It is, therefore, natural for the Korean schools in Japan to be granted an equal right with the Japanese ones and any discrimination against the national education of Chongryon is intolerable in the light of international law.
					
					 In a word, Japan's recent discriminative measure amounts to a serious human rights abuse and inhumanitarian action quite contrary to the call for ensuring human rights and humanitarianism.
					
					 It once again brought to light that Japan is a mean and brazenfaced country lost to conscience and morality.
					
					 Japan would be well advised to pay heed to the pubic accusation and condemnation at home and abroad and prudently and properly settle the above-said issue.
					
					 If the Japanese authorities persistently pursue national discrimination and an inhumanitarian policy in disregard of the just demand of the Korean people and the international community, they will not be able to escape bitterer international rebuff and criticism.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Il Sung's Work Marked
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Il Sung's Work Marked
 Pyongyang, April 5 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Monday dedicates a signed article to the 20th anniversary of President Kim Il Sung's work "On Improving the Economic Management in Line with the Intrinsic Nature of Socialist Economy."
					 The work, published on April 4, Juche 79 (1990), is a historic work which makes it possible to accelerate the economic construction and give full play to the advantages of the socialist economic system of the DPRK by managing the national economy to meet the intrinsic requirements of socialism.  
					
					 Elucidated in the work are the principled issues arising in firmly protecting Korean-style economic management system, whose vitality has been clearly proved in history and practice, under the changed circumstances. 
					
					 The past two decades since the publication of the work witnessed the demonstration of the greatness of feats performed by President Kim Il Sung who clearly indicated the road to be followed by our economy with his brilliant far-sighted wisdom and provided the system and method of economic management for building a socialist economic power. They represent the course during which the might of our independent economy has been steadily consolidated under the wise leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il who has firmly protected the socialist economic system provided by the President and worked hard to build a thriving nation of Juche in this land with its might. 
					
					 The work indicates the important principled issues arising in giving play to the advantages of the socialist planned economy.  It also clarifies the idea that high revolutionary zeal and creativeness of leading economic officials serve as an important factor which decides the success in the socialist economic construction and tasks and ways for firmly defending and glorifying the rural economic system in our country. 
					
					 The work serves as important guidelines to be held fast to by officials and other working people in the socialist economic construction, concludes the article.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Accused of Blocking Resumption of Tour
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Accused of Blocking Resumption of Tour
 Pyongyang, April 5 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification in a statement on April 1 accused the present regime of south Korea of still standing in the way of resuming the tour of Mt. Kumgang while insisting on the "three conditions" only. This is aimed at totally bedeviling the inter-Korean relations, the statement said.
					 Strongly denouncing the present regime for its moves to escalate confrontation with the DPRK, the statement urged the authorities to opt for opening the way for inter-Korean reconciliation and unity as early as possible.
					
					 It is very unreasonable for the dictatorial regime to hinder the resumption of tour of Mt. Kumgang so much desired by all the fellow countrymen in the south and stand in the way of peace and prosperity and independent reunification of the nation, it noted.
					
					 It called upon all the people to certainly punish the "Grand National Party" and the dictatorial regime by their concerted efforts under the banner of "By our nation itself".

articles.title: Japan's Scheme to Grab Tok Islets Flayed
articles.content:
Japan's Scheme to Grab Tok Islets Flayed
 Pyongyang, April 5 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Peace in Asia and Education in History in south Korea issued a statement on March 31 denouncing the Japanese authorities for their moves to grab Tok Islets.
					 Recalling that the Japanese authorities passed textbooks for primary school children in which Tok Islets are marked as part of Japan's territory through examination, the statement charged that this is an act of diametrically running counter to the trend of the international community to set right history as it is another clear proof of Japan's territorial ambition for the islets.
					
					 Noting that Japan envisages marking the islets as part of its territory in textbook for all middle school students next year, it added that we can no longer remain an onlooker to Japan's moves to revive militarism.
					
					 We will strongly react to Japan's moves for grabbing the islets in solidarity with the peoples of all the countries standing for peace, the statement stressed.

articles.title: Day of Sun Commemorated
articles.content:
Day of Sun Commemorated 
 Pyongyang, April 5 (KCNA) -- A remembrance meeting, film shows and photo exhibitions were held in China, Cambodia, Egypt and Ukraine from Mar. 28 to Apr. 1 on the occasion of the Day of the Sun.
					 Displayed in the venues of the photo exhibition halls were photos on the revolutionary history and the immortal exploits of Kim Il Sung and photos on the invincible might of Songun Korea and the DPRK people in their struggle for the building of a great prosperous and powerful nation.
					
					 The deputy prime minister in charge of the Royal Palace of Cambodia said at the meeting that the king, the great king and the people of Cambodia deeply respect Kim Il Sung as friend dearest to them.
					
					 He expressed belief that the friendly relations between the two countries provided by Norodom Sihanouk, Great King of Cambodia, and Kim Il Sung would continue to grow stronger generation after generation.
					
					 Kim Il Sung is the founder of socialist Korea and the eternal president of the Korean people who performed undying feats for the nation-building, he said.
					
					 The chairman of the Egyptian Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea said at the film show that Kim Il Sung paid deep attention to the development of the friendly relations between the DPRK and Egypt and extended support and solidarity to the just cause of the peoples of Arab countries including Egypt. He highly praised him as a great leader who led the human cause of independence to victory.
					
					 The participants of the film shows watched Korean films including "Mangyongdae" and "Fireworks for a Thriving Nation."

articles.title: Banquete en honor del nuevo embajador chino
articles.content:
Banquete en honor del nuevo embajador chino 
Pyongyang, 5 de abril (ATCC) -- El Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y el Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea ofrecieron el dia 3 por la noche un banquete en honor del nuevo embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario de la Republica Popular China en Corea. 
					El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del PTC, Presidente del CDN de la RPDC y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea asistio a la cena. 
					
					Participaron los secretarios del CC del PTC Choe Thae Bok, Kim Ki Nam y otros cuadros directivos del CC del PTC, el miembro del CDN de la RPDC y primer subjefe de la Direccion Politica General del EPC Kim Jong Gak, los generales de ejercito del EPC Kim Won Hong, Hyon Chol Hae y otros miembros de mando del CDN y el EPC, y los funcionarios directivos del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores. 
					
					Fueron invitados los miembros de la embajada china en Corea y las jugadoras del equipo de voleibol (F) de Tianjin de China, de visita en Corea. 
					
					Cuando salio el Dirigente Kim Jong Il junto con el nuevo embajador chino Liu Hongcai al lugar del banquete, todos los participantes le acogieron con entusiasmo al Dirigente quien hace un aporte inmortal al fortalecimiento de la amistad Corea-China y le rindieron sublime homenaje. 
					
					El secretario del CC del PTC Kim Ki Nam y el embajador chino Liu Hongcai hicieron uso de la palabra de brindis. 
					
					Los oradores expresaron la firme voluntad de los dos partidos y los dos pueblos de consolidar y desarrollar generacion tras generacion la tradicional amistad Corea-China preparada y desarrollada por los dirigentes de generacion veterana de los dos paises.
					
					La comida transcurrio en un ambiente amistoso.

articles.title: Publicado comunicado sobre visita de Kim Yong Nam a Gambia
articles.content:
Publicado comunicado sobre visita de Kim Yong Nam a Gambia
Pyongyang, 5 de abril (ATCC) -- Quedo publicado el dia 3 en Banjul el comunicado conjunto sobre la visita oficial y de amistad del presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, a la Republica de Gambia.
					 El documento senala como sigue:
					
					 Por invitacion del presidente de Gambia, Yaya A. J. J. Jammeh, el presidente del Presidium de la APS de la RPDC, Kim Yong Nam, realizo una visita oficial y de amistad a Gambia del primero al 3 de abril de 2010.
					
					 Durante la visita Kim Yong Nam y Yaya A. J. J. Jammeh sostuvieron las conversaciones bilaterales.
					
					 En las ocasiones ambos mandatarios expresaron la necesidad de consolidar mas la amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises.
					
					 Intercambiaron las opiniones sobre el estado politico y economico en la Peninsula Coreana, el continente africano u otras regiones del mundo y debatieron el problema sobre la preservacion de la paz y la seguridad como premisa para el desarrollo.
					
					 Tambien manifestaron  sus voluntades de colaborar contra todos los elementos que impiden la paz, la seguridad y el progreso en la Peninsula Coreana y el continente africano y afirmaron que es imposible lograr la estabilidad sin la paz.
					
					 Expresaron sus decisiones de desarrollar la cooperacion Sur-Sur y cooperar entre si en la ONU, el Movimiento de los No Alineados, la Union Africana u otras organizaciones internacionales.
					
					 Enfatizaron una vez mas la necesidad de respetar las reglas sobre la paz y la seguridad del mundo y asegurar la justicia y la tolerancia.
					
					 Kim expreso su agradecimiento al presidente, el gobierno y el pueblo de Gambia por haberle dado cordial hospitalidad durante su permanencia en ese pais africano e invito a su homologo gambiano a visitar a Corea en un futuro cercano.
					
					 Yaya A. J. J. Jammeh lo acepto y decidio fijar el periodo de visita a traves de la via diplomatica.

articles.title: Rubricados convenios entre Corea y Gambia
articles.content:
Rubricados convenios entre Corea y Gambia
Pyongyang, 5 de abril (ATCC) -- Fueron firmados en Banjul los convenios sobre la amistad y cooperacion entre la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y la Republica de Gambia, sobre el establecimiento del comite conjunto entre los dos gobiernos y sobre la colaboracion tecnica en varias ramas.
					 En la ceremonia de firmas participaron por la parte coreana el presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema, Kim Yong Nam, el ministro de Salud Publica, Choe Chang Sik, el vicecanciller, Kim Hyong Jun, el viceministro de Comercio Exterior, Ri Myong San y el embajador coreano en este pais africano Ri Kyong Son y, por la gambiana, el presidente Yaya A. J. J. Jammeh, la vicepresidenta Aja Isatou Njie Saidy, el secretario general de la presidencia, Mariama Khan, el ministro de Pesqueria, Recursos Hidraulicos y de Asuntos  Parlamentarios, Ramin Kaba Bajo, etc.
					
					 Los suscribieron Kim Yong Nam, Kim Hyong Jun, Ri Myong San, Yaya A. J. J. Jammeh y Ramin Kaba Bajo, respectivamente.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam agradece a Yaya A. J. J. Jammeh
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam agradece a Yaya A. J. J. Jammeh
Pyongyang, 5 de abril (ATCC) -- Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, envio el dia 3 un telegrama de agradecimiento al presidente de la Republica de Gambia, Yaya A. J. J. Jammeh saliendo de Banjul tras realizar la visita oficial y de amistad a este pais africano.
					Kim, en su telegrama, expreso su gran agradecimiento al presidente, el gobierno y el pueblo de Gambia por haberles dado una calurosa bienvenida y hospitalidad cordial.
					
					Tambien expreso su satisfaccion de que su visita de esta vez sirvio de un motivo significativo para profundizar la comprension mutua y la fraternidad entre ambos pueblos y promover aun mas el desarrollo de las relaciones bilaterales.
					
					Ademas se refirio a que constataba con sus propios ojos los excelentes exitos del pueblo gambiano logrados en el florecimiento y la prosperidad del pais y quedaba muy emocionado por el respecto.
					
					Por ultimo, Kim formulo votos por un nuevo progreso y el bienestar del amistoso pueblo gambiano y la buena salud de Yaya A. J. J. Jammeh y los exitos de su trabajo.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam parte de Banjul
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam parte de Banjul
Pyongyang, 5 de abril (ATCC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, partio el dia 3 de Banjul tras realizar la visita oficial y de amistad a la Republica de Gambia.
					Kim y su comitiva fueron despedidos por la vicepresidenta de Gambia Aja Isatou Njie Saidy, el presidente de la Asamblea Nacional Elizabeth Lenne, el secretario general de la Presidencia, Mariama Khan, el ministro de Pesqueria, Recursos Hidraulicos y de Asuntos Parlamentarios Ramin Kaba Bajo y otros ministros del gobierno, los comandantes del Ejercito y otros interesados, los representantes diplomaticos de varios paises y los de las organizaciones internacionales acreditados en este pais africano.
					
					En el aeropuerto hubo una ceremonia de despedida de Kim.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam llega a Dakar
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam llega a Dakar 
Pyongyang, 5 de abril (ATCC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, llego el dia 3 a Dakar para realizar una visita oficial y de amistad a la Republica del Senegal.
					Le acompanaron el ministro de Salud Publica Choe Chang Sik, el vicecanciller Kim Hyong Jun, el viceministro de Comercio Exterior Ri Myong San y otros.
					
					En el aeropuerto, Kim Yong Nam y su comitiva fueron acogidos por el primer ministro Souleymane Ndene Ndiaye, el ministro del Estado y de Relaciones Exteriores Becaye Diop, el ministro del Estado y de Finanzas Abdoulaye Diop, el ministro del Estado y de las Fuerzas Armadas Balde y otros miembros del gobierno, del Senegal, asi como el embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario coreano en este pais Ri Kyong Son.
					
					En la terminal aerea hubo la ceremonia para dar bienvenida a Kim.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam participa en un acto de descubrimiento de monumento
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam participa en un acto  de descubrimiento de monumento
Pyongyang, 5 de abril (ATCC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea Kim Yong Nam, que realiza la visita oficial y de amistad a la Republica del Senegal, participo el dia 3 en la ceremonia de descubrimiento del "Monumento a la Restauracion de Africa".
					 El monumento que describe bien en lo plastico y artistico la ferrea voluntad y firme temperamento de los pueblos africanos que aspiran a la independencia y la construccion de nueva sociedad y pretenden abrir con sus propias fuerzas el futuro luminoso, fue erguido durante el corto plazo en cooperacion con los tecnicos coreanos.
					
					 En la ocasion estuvieron presentes el presidente senegales, Abdoulaye Wade, los jefes de estados y gobiernos de mas de 20 paises africanos, los representantes de varias organizaciones internacionales y regionales, los representantes diplomaticos de varios paises en el Senegal y millares de capitalinos.
					
					 Los presidentes y ex presidentes de varios paises africanos y los representantes de las organizaciones internacionales y regionales, en sus discursos de la ocasion, se refirieron a que el monumento fue levantado magnificamente, lo cual es un orgullo del Senegal y Africa.
					
					 Expresaron sus convicciones de que los pueblos africanos lograran mayor progreso con la fe en el futuro.

articles.title: Recae sobre EE.UU., la culpa de restos mortales de tropas yanquis
articles.content:
Recae sobre EE.UU., la culpa de restos mortales de tropas yanquis
Pyongyang, 5 de abril (ATCC) -- Por no poder observar el hecho de que los numerosos restos mortales de las tropas norteamericanas se descuidan por los buldozeres y los aperos agricolas y se revocan en varios lugares de Corea, la Representacion del Ejercito Popular de Corea en Phanmunjom propuso a la parte de Estados Unidos tomar las medidas inminentes al respecto. Pero, el segundo dio espalda a la buena voluntad y los esfuerzos de la primera bajo el absurdo pretexto politico como las "conversaciones a 6 bandas".
					En relacion con esta, el representante de la Representacion del EPC en Phanmunjom hizo publica el dia 5 una declaracion que senala en particular:
					
					El dia 27 de enero y el 26 de febrero, la Representacion del EPC en Phanmunjom entrego al Departamento de Defensa Estadounidense, a traves del representante de las tropas norteamericanas  estacionadas en el Sur de Corea, el detallado estado y las fotos de que durante el arreglo de tierra de gran envergadura y el proceso de los preparativos para la agricultura que se desarrollan recientemente en la RPDC, en mas de 10 lugares inclusive los distritos de Kujang y Unsan y la zona de Jangjin, fueron desenterrados los restos mortales de las tropas norteamericanas (el representativo resto mortal: el nombre Ackly Philip. W, y el servicio militar No. 20139638), y estan rodeando por el suelo e informo de que tome urgentemente las medidas al respecto..
					
					Sin embargo, la parte del Departamento de Defensa de EE.UU. dijo que "la devolucion de los restos mortales de los uniformados estadounidenses a su pais es la importante cuestion para el gobierno de EE.UU., pero, espere un momento porque no esta arreglada todavia tal posicion debido a los asuntos internos" y no dio ninguna respuesta al respecto aunque pasaron mas de decenas de dias.
					
					El Departamento de Estado Norteamericano senalo que "son posibles en el marco de las conversaciones a 6 bandas cualesquier negociaciones entre EE.UU. y la RPDC, y es igual con eso tambien la labor humanitaria como el desenterramiento de los restos mortales. Esto es la posicion de EE.UU." y descuido abiertamente la sinceridad humanitaria de la RPDC.
					
					La RPDC no puede menos de sorprender ante el hecho de que EE.UU., que ha presentado hasta ahora como "elevados principios y altos deberes"   diciendo que no son compatibles el problema humanitario y la politica, dio la espalda bajo el pretexto politico a la realidad de que los restos mortales de sus militares rodean por suelo.
					
					A decir verdad, los restos mortales de las tropas norteamericanas enterrados en la RPDC, son los de los uniformados yanquis quienes asesinaron a los habitantes coreanos y cometieron actos hostiles contra estos en el periodo de la pasada guerra coreana.
					
					A nosotros no incumben la responsabilidad ni deber de desenterrar y devolver estos restos mortales que son simbolo de rencor acumulado del pueblo coreano.
					
					Pero, la parte coreana permitio excepcionalmente el desenterramiento comun del particular, al cabo de considerar seriamente el caracter humanitario de esta labor y la repetida peticion de los familiares de los participantes en la guerra coreana en Estados Unidos y la ex administracion de EE.UU., y en particular, en consideracion de que esto es el problema solucionado entre el Presidente Kim Il Sung y el ex presidente estadounidense Carter cuando estaba de visita en Pyongyang. Entrego a la parte de EE.UU. los 229 de restos mortales mediante el desenterramiento comun de 33 veces.
					
					Los relacionados del Departamento de Defensa estadounidense, las entidades de veteranos, los familiares de victimas e incluso el presidente estadounidense de aquel entonces Clinton expresaron en varias veces agradecimiento por tales esfuerzos sinceros de la RPDC. 
					
					Sin embargo, tan pronto como tomo el poder, la anterior administracion estadounidense de Bush acuso a la RPDC del "eje del mal" y "base avanzada de tirania". Ademas, al dejar como un estropajo el acuerdo entre el Ejercito Popular de Corea y el Departamento de Defensa estadounidense, interrumpio de manera unilateral e inhumanitaria, bajo el pretexto de la "garantia de seguridad", el desenterramiento conjunto de restos mortales de uniformados estadounidenses, que se realizaba  bien durante 10 anos sin desviacion alguna. 
					
					Pero, la RPDC hizo todo lo posible para asegurar la seguridad de los miembros de la parte norteamericana, gracias a lo cual durante este decenio de la obra de desenterramiento conjunto no ocurrio ningun caso anormal, sino los participantes estadounidenses en esa obra confesaron en varias ocasiones que trabajaron en Corea en el ambiente mejor que en otros paises.
					
					La "garantia de seguridad" es una palabra irracional que difundieron las autoridades norteamericanas con la intencion de encubrir su malsano objetivo politico. 
					
					Es inflexible la posicion de la RPDC.
					
					La RPDC presento la propuesta de tomar las medidas urgentes por no poder observar con negligencia el hecho de que por todas las partes de nuestro pais muchos restos mortales de uniformados estadounidenses se descuidan por los buldozeres y  los aperos agricolas. Sin embargo, la parte norteamericana da espaldas a tales esfuerzos sinceros de la RPDC bajo los pretextos politicos absurdos como las "conversaciones a 6 bandas".
					
					Ya no tenemos otro remedio mas que dejar al Departamento de Defensa estadounidense, responsable de este problema, rescaten o no a los restos mortales de sus uniformados.
					
					No prestaremos atencion a que se desentierren y se vaguen los restos mortales estadounidenses en varios lugares de nuestro pais.
					
					Si se desaparecen miles de restos mortales de uniformados estadounidenses en nuestro pais, debido a que EE.UU. desprecio la sinceridad de la RPDC, la responsabilidad por el respecto recaera enteramente sobre EE.UU. que hizo politico el problema humanitario.

articles.title: Ejercito titere surcoreano perpetra una provocacion armada
articles.content:
Ejercito titere surcoreano perpetra una provocacion armada
Pyongyang, 5 de abril (ATCC) -- Los titeres surcoreanos perpetraron el dia 4 en la zona desmilitarizada del oriente del frente una grave provocacion armada.
					A eso de las 14 y 7 del mismo dia, los bandidos armados del ejercito titere que penetraron en la zona desmilitarizada al sur de la marca de la linea de la demarcacion militar No.1270 tiraron los canones sin retroceso de 90 mm hacia el puesto de la policia civil de la parte de la RPDC.
					
					Debido a eso, la seguridad personal de los miembros de la policia civil de la RPDC que estaban de guardia normal se vio gravemente amenazada.
					
					Tal incidente es la provocacion premeditada de los titeres surcoreanos que intentan agudizar intencionalmente la situacion de la zona desmilitarizada de la linea de la demarcacion militar.
					
					Debido a tal provocacion militar perpetrada abiertamente en pleno dia frente al puesto militar de la RPDC se ha creado en esta zona la situacion muy tensa.
